Documents prerequisites including AWS CLI, SAM CLI, Python 3.11, and setup commands for building and deploying the SAM project.

Provides technical notes for CI/CD pipeline setup including GitHub Actions or AWS CodePipeline configuration, secure AWS credentials setup, environment-specific deployment configurations, and linting/type checking integration.
Defines acceptance criteria and technical notes for CI/CD pipeline setup. Specifies prerequisites (Story 1.1) and covers infrastructure foundation that supports all functional requirements.
Contains detailed architecture patterns, project structure notes, learnings from previous stories, testing standards, and references to related documentation.

package.name: aws-sam-cli
package.reason: Required for sam build and sam deploy commands

package.name: github-actions
package.reason: CI/CD platform for automated builds and deployments

constraint.description: Use GitHub Actions for automated builds and deployments (alternative: AWS CodePipeline) as specified in architecture document
Separate stacks per environment (dev/prod) with environment-specific SAM configurations. Deploy to dev on merge to main, deploy to prod on tagged releases
Run automated tests before deployment to ensure code quality. Tests must pass before deployment proceeds
Pipeline workflow: Build (sam build) → Test (pytest) → Lint (flake8/pylint, mypy) → Deploy Dev (on merge to main) → Deploy Prod (on tagged releases)
Use separate SAM configuration files (samconfig.dev.toml, samconfig.prod.toml) for environment-specific settings. Store AWS credentials securely using GitHub Secrets
Configure least privilege IAM permissions for deployment role. Use environment-specific stack names: location-detection-dev, location-detection-prod
Use Python 3.11 runtime as specified in architecture. Configure Python 3.11 in GitHub Actions build environment
Maintain existing SAM project structure established in Story 1.1 and Story 1.2. CI/CD pipeline should build and deploy existing structure without modification

GitHub Actions workflow file: ci-cd.yml or deploy.yml. SAM config files: samconfig.{env}.toml. Stack names: {project}-{environment}. GitHub Secrets: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_REGION

interfaces.interface: Defines automated build, test, and deployment jobs triggered by push to main, pull requests, and tags
Builds Lambda functions and dependencies. Must be executed in CI/CD build job
Deploys SAM application to AWS. Must be executed with environment-specific config (dev/prod)
Runs unit and integration tests. Must be executed before deployment
Secure storage for AWS credentials. Accessed via ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }} syntax in GitHub Actions
Environment-specific SAM deployment configuration. Contains stack name, region, and deployment parameters

tests.standards: The CI/CD pipeline must run pytest tests from src/tests/unit/ and src/tests/integration/ directories before deployment. Tests use pytest framework with configuration from pytest.ini. Test structure follows patterns established in Story 1.2: unit tests for individual functions/classes, integration tests for API endpoints and services. Pipeline testing includes workflow syntax validation, build job completion, test job execution, deployment job execution, status check reporting, and deployment trigger validation.

ideas.idea: Test workflow syntax validation - verify GitHub Actions YAML is valid
Test build job completes successfully - verify sam build runs without errors
Test test job runs and fails on test failures - verify pytest execution and failure handling
Test deployment jobs deploy to correct environments - verify dev deployment on merge to main, prod deployment on tags
Test status checks appear on pull requests - verify GitHub Actions status reporting
Test deployment triggers - verify merge to main triggers dev deployment, tags trigger prod deployment
Test GitHub Secrets are accessible in workflow - verify AWS credentials are available
Test linting job runs and fails on lint errors - verify flake8/pylint execution
Test end-to-end pipeline execution - verify complete workflow from build to deployment
